snippet: The state’s booming economy has drawn job-seekers, but apartments are scarce, and homelessness has soared.
abstract: Wyoming's booming energy economy has drawn many job-seekers, but apartments are scarce and expensive, and homelessness has soared by 67 percent since 2011; homeless advocates say Casper's few shelters and temporary housing are full, and wait for low-income apartments has swelled to as long as two and a half years.
lead_paragraph: The state’s booming economy has drawn job-seekers, but apartments are scarce, and homelessness has soared.

headline.seo: Homelessness Increases in Wyoming, Product of Economic Boom
headline.main: In Wyoming, Many Jobs but No Place to Call Home
headline.print_headline: In Wyoming, Many Jobs But No Place To Call Home
